body:
It would be great if Temporal added out-of-the-box support for a read-only user role.

This should manifest not just in the frontend API's but also in the UI (e.g. no Terminate button displayed when a read-only user is logged in).

The `authorization.ClaimMapper` interface does currently support the notion of a ReadOnly role, and so operators can write custom claim mappers that assign ReadOnly roles to namespaces, but to effectively enforce the ReadOnly role, the operator would also have to write a custom Authorizer that understands the universe of possible values for `authorization.CallTarget.APIName` and renders a decision on whether any given APIName is ReadOnly or ReadWrite. It seems like this categorization of APINames into ReadOnly/ReadWrite/Admin categories should be done in the stock OSS code.

If there was such a built-in categorization available, then the default authorizer could use it to enforce the ReadOnly role. That's what I mean by out-of-the-box.

For the UI aspect of it, presumably the UI would need access to the `authorization.Claims` returned by the ClaimMapper for the logged in user.
title: Add out-of-the-box support for read-only role
